"No log out, no reporting in, if I didn't know better I'd say you 
were running away." Lunarpine's voice was loud, it had to be to be 
heard over the wind and snow. The fury of the storm had let up to a 
windy light snowfall. "I wasn't doing a recon of this area until I 
learned you were missing. I heard the Preds transmission and thought 
I could scrap the damn thing." 

What he was accually thinking was "before he scrapped her." Lunarpine 
didn't want to admit that he let emotion override his logic sensors. 
Especially to her.

"Now then, transform and we'll get back to base and give Prowl a full 
report."

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She looked at the gun in her hand. She lowered it and put is away.
> "Sorry about the gun.  I thought you were the pred who was 
following 
> me."  She looked at him and looked away. She said in a soft 
tone, "i 
> figured the storm would disrupt the preds reading enough so he 
> couldn't find me."  She thought for a moment. She turned and looked 
> at him. "Why were you doing a recon out here for? There is nothing 
> out here but snow and ice." She was mad at herself for being 
careless 
> and letting him find her. "And just what do you want me to explain?"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > "Hello Wing" Lunarpine replied as she stood up. he ducked down 
> > realizing her gun was drawn."I was following your scent. it was 
> > leading me toward the pile." "Smart move, hiding like that. Dumb 
> move 
> > hiding in a storm." Lunarpine lowered his arms to his side hoping 
> > Shadow Wing would do the same. "I was doing a routine recon when 
I 
> > caught your scent, care to explain?" Lunarpine wasn't happy with 
> the  trouble he'd gone through just to have her stick a gun in his 
> face.
